newsitem.title: USA: Merck and Rhone-Poulenc form animal health co.
newsitem.headline: Merck and Rhone-Poulenc form animal health co.

text.p: Merck & Co Inc and Rhone-Poulenc said Thursday they plan to combine their animal health and poultry genetics businesses to form a new company that will be the largest in the animal health and poultry genetics industries, a statement from the two companies said.
The new, global company, to be called Merial Animal Health, will be a stand-alone, 50-50 joint venture with a revenue base of $1.7 billion (approximate combined 1996 sales), the statement said.
In 1995, the Merck animal health and Rhone Merieux animal health businesses held second-and fourth-place market rankings respectively, the statement said.
Their combined 1996 sales will be about $1.4 billion in a market totaling $10.7 billion, the statement said.
Merial Animal Health is expected to be fully operational in the second quarter of 1997, the statement said.
